item.title: Dead fox at Essex Road Station, 17th October
item.description:
Good morning, We have a dead fox on the spiral staircase at Essex Road Railway Station. It needs to be disposed. Is there any chance you could help us with this issue? It's already been here for 2 days. Many thanks, Aura Cozma Essex Road - Great Northern Railway 0330 095 7353
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Canonbury Road, Islington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 42-44 Fortune Green Road, 17th October
item.description:
Our buildings are shaking every time a bus passes by and hits the pothole between 42-44 Fortune Green Road that is adjacent to the pavement. This is extremely worriesome for the structural integrity of the builds as it appears that there is a sewage or water pipe beneath the pothole. Please fix this before one our buildings is compromised! We are also concerned about the speed at which the busses are driving on this road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, Fortune Green Road, West Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Persistent overnight parking in front of Park entrance, 17th October
item.description:
This is one fir Haringey Council, I believe. Every evening a car parks overnight at the head/ mouth of the park. They move themselves by 08:00 usually. The problem for cars; large vans; pedestrians (including Police and emergency services), is that they cannot access the park because of this selfish parking. I have witnessed the Police coming down Norfolk Close and then have to reverse out. Moreover, every car that tries to turn usually ends up hitting my car on my drive, or coming very close. We need a clear turning circle. Parking restrictions down Norfolk Close needs to be monitored and reviewed. Wardens needs to come down here, please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Norfolk Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bike abandoned for over a year, blocking path, 17th October
item.description:
This bike has 2 flat tyres and has been here for over 1 year. Council attached a sign in August saying it would remove it in 1 week but hasn’t done so. It’s now Oct. It is tied to a lamp post and falls regularly blocking the path to wheel chair users.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Springdale Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Enormous pothole nearby bus stop on Crystal Palace parade.facing towards College Road, 17th October
item.description:
Q I am writing to report a recurring highway defect which has now reappeared for the third time (previously repaired in 2022 and 2023). The severity of this defect is causing substantial vibration damage to my proper approximately 100 feet from the site, resulting in: visible water movement in containers, bed and furniture vibration, window rattling, and sleep deprivation. This constitutes actionable nuisance and potential breach of your statutory duty under Section 41 of the Highways Act 1980 to maintain the highway to a safe standard. Given the repeated failure of temporary repairs and the location above a historic subterranean structure, I require immediate inspection and permanent remedial works—not another inadequate surface patch. The ongoing structural vibration raises serious concerns about potential damage to both my property and the historic structure beneath the carriageway. As well as the vehicles driving over it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crystal Palace Parade, London
Report on FixMyStreet
